channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15463] Region normalizer should check whether split/merge is enabled
item.description:
HBASE-15128 added switch for disabling split / merge.

When split / merge switch is turned off, region normalizer should not perform split / merge operation, respectively.
item.summary: Region normalizer should check whether split/merge is enabled

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
+    } catch (ServiceException se) {

+      splitEnabled = false;

+      LOG.debug("Unable to determine whether split is enabled", se);

+    }

Why we need to set splitEnabled to be false when exception catched?

Normally ServiceException shouldn't be encountered since normalizer is in the same JVM as master.
Setting to false is conservative.

Do you have suggestion ?
My suggestion is do nothing. The original state for split/merge is "true", not "false".

-1 overall
